summary: This document is an email chain from June 2020 between FBI personnel and a US Attorney's Office (USANYS) regarding the acquisition of Ghislaine Maxwell's American Express credit card statements as part of the financial investigation. The discussion focuses on obtaining a 'refresh' production of statements, clarifying account numbers, and referencing prior productions.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the credit card records being requested and analyzed by the FBI forensic accountant. Her AMEX statements are the focus of the email chain.

events.title: FBI provides draft credit card analysis
events.description: An FBI forensic accountant sends a draft analysis of Ghislaine Maxwell's credit cards from financial productions to the US Attorney's Office for discussion.

events.title: Email discussion on AMEX statement refresh
events.description: FBI and US Attorney's Office personnel correspond to clarify the process for obtaining a refresh of Maxwell's American Express credit card statements, referencing a prior production with a closing date of December 18, 2019.

locations: 26 Federal Plaza, NYC, NY 10278 (FBI New York Field Office)
keyFacts: The FBI was actively seeking a 'refresh' production of Ghislaine Maxwell's American Express credit card statements as of June 2020.
The last AMEX statement in possession had a closing date of December 18, 2019, with Bates numbers AMEX001762 through AMEX001770.
The FBI forensic accountant had prepared a draft analysis of Maxwell's credit cards from financial productions for discussion with prosecutors.
The correspondence shows coordination between the FBI New York Field Office and the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) on financial evidence collection.
The document references an AMEX file number (CI-5VSL5) and an Experian report used to obtain full account numbers.
